description.narrative: Human Resources Capacities available for PESP effectiveness, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more disadvantaged and excluded children are benefiting from an improved policy environment and strengthened social protection system

mailing-address.narrative: Gerief west [Manshiya] block # First District H Plots numbers 6/3

sector.narrative: Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Sudan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Sudan Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Protection)
UNICEF Programmes in Sudan (Communication for Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Sudan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Human Resources Capacities available for PESP effectiveness

description.narrative: UNICEF social policy programme and planning monitoring and evaluation functions in Sudan are designed, implemented and monitored by a high caliber of staff and consultants deployed in the main office in Khartoum and in 6 field offices and 5 sub-offices across Sudan. 13 staff members and 19 UN volunteers are currently onboard within the social policy and planning, monitoring and evaluation sections. Diverse and changing needs in the country required a team of diverse backgrounds. 17 out of the staff and UNVs members are female (53%). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
